ingredients.name: 2 tsp garlic, minced, or 1 tsp garlic powder
2 cups spinach, or fresh package of basil (.5 oz)
super firm tofu, cut into 8 squares (or desired size)
all purpose flour (use gluten free if needed)
coconut cream (can sub with vegan sour cream)
sun dried tomatoes in oil/tomato paste
low or no sodium vegetable broth
30 ounces cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed
broccoli florets, cut into bite size pieces
Starch slurry (1 tbsp cornstarch + 1-2 tbsp of water)
1 Raw Beet, sliced extra fine, ideally on a mandolin (or cooked & chopped roughly)
Small Handful Macadamia Nuts, chopped small
1 cup/200g Stewed Grains & lentils [click for recipe]
2 cups cooked brown rice, sushi rice or whatever rice you prefer (slightly warm but not hot)
2 cups cooked brown rice, quinoa, or couscous
1 block  extra firm tofu,  frozen, thawed and pressed* (1 block is 14-16oz)
1 head broccoli florets,  cut into bite size pieces (can also use the stems or save for another dish)
½ cup low sodium soy sauce (114g)
3 tbsp brown sugar (can sub with maple syrup)
¼-1/2 tsp red pepper flakes,  optional
¼ tsp salt,  more to taste
¼ tsp black pepper,  more to taste
½ cup water,  more as needed to thin
½ cup low sodium soy sauce
2 blocks super firm tofu,  cut into 8 squares (or desired size)
4 tbsp all purpose flour (use gluten free if needed)
½ cup coconut cream (can sub with vegan sour cream)
¼ tsp each Salt and pepper
1 cup uncooked brown basmati rice, rinsed
15 oz can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1 can (15oz) canned white beans (Cannellini, Navy, Great Northern)
1 cup veggie broth (just cube if can of tomato)
can serve w/ bread or rice
2 oranges,  both juiced and 1 zested (need ½ cup or 120g juice)
400g extra firm tofu, pressed, roughly broken into pieces,
¼ cup neutral oil for frying
2  tbsp of authentic Korean soup soy sauce (or regular soy sauce) – adjust to your taste
3  tbsp of perilla seed  flour (deulkkae garu)
3 tbsp Gochujang Korean red pepper paste
1 block tofu extra firm tofu, cut into bite-sized cubes
2 tbsp maple syrup or agave nectar or any syrup
1/2 tsp cinnamon optional but highly recommended
2 cups white rice dry short grain
4 tbsp gochujang more or less depending on preference, around 1 tbsp per serving
4 tsp roasted sesame oil more or less depending on preference, around 1 tsp per serving
1 tbsp Maple syrup or agave nectar
⅓ cup low sodium soy sauce (75g)
¼ tsp red pepper flakes,  more or less to taste
4 cups day old cooked rice, white or brown (485g)
400g extra firm tofu,  frozen, then thawed, pressed, and cubed*
3 tbsp brown sugar (can sub lime juice)
½ tsp red chili flakes,  optional
1 head broccoli,  steamed (edamame, bok choy, snap peas are other good alternatives)
1 cup coconut milk or favorite non-dairy milk
1 (16 oz) block super-firm (high protein) tofu cut into small cubes
1" thumb fresh ginger peeled and minced or grated (about 1 tbsp)
1-2 serrano peppers finely diced; see notes about spice level
2 small Roma tomatoes seeds removed, diced
1/2 tsp kashmiri chili powder optional – can sub paprika (mild) or cayenne (spicy)
1/3 cup full-fat coconut milk can sub vegan yogurt or cashew cream
2 15oz cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
2 – 3 cups unsweetened dairy free milk use soy for more protein
2 tbsp vegan butter or olive oil
1 ¼ tsp arrowroot or cornstarch or 1 tbsp all-purpose flour
Add soy sauce & olive oil & garlic powder to veggies
½ cup water,  more as needed to thin
½ cup low sodium soy sauce
400 g block  extra firm tofu, pressed, roughly broken into pieces,
¼ cup neutral oil for frying
¼ tsp red pepper flakes,  more or less to taste
4 cups day old cooked rice, white or brown (485g)
400g extra firm tofu (airfried) w/ broc airfried
3 tbsp brown sugar (can sub lime juice)
½ tsp red chili flakes,  optional
1 head broccoli,  steamed (edamame, bok choy, snap peas are other good alternatives)
2 cups walnuts,  soaked in boiling hot water for at least 30 minutes
½ tbsp coconut sugar (sub with brown sugar)
⅛ tsp cayenne pepper (add up to ¼ is spicier preferred)
½ tbsp coconut aminos (sub with soy sauce or tamari)
14 oz block extra firm tofu,  drained, pressed, and smash into crumbles
1-2 cups vegan shredded cheese  (cheddar or Mexican preferred)
3/4 cup Korean kimchi sea salt or flake sea salt (If you’re using a fine sea salt, reduce it to 1/2 cup)
6 to 8 oz well ripped persimmon (approximately 2 medium size), peeled
1 tbsp Korean kimchi sea salt or flake sea salt (If you’re using a fine sea salt, reduce it to 2 tsp)
3/4 cup gochugaru, Korean red pepper flakes (reduce amount to 1/3 to 1/2 cup if you like mild spicy)
8 to 10 oz Korean radish or daikon, peeled and thinly julienne
4 green onions, halves in lengthwise then cut into 1-inch long pieces
4 oz Korean mustard, thinly julienne carrot or garlic chive
1 Tb  Olive oil mix + same mix
3  tbsp lemon juice, or lime juice
2 tsp garlic, minced, or 1 tsp garlic powder
2 cups spinach, or fresh package of basil (.5 oz)
225g Wheat Noodles somen (somyun) noodles or any thin & chewy wheat noodles
1,5 tbsp peanut butter or cashew butter
2 cup soy milk plain or water (more if needed)
4 tsp sugar less if you want it less sweet
2 blocks super firm tofu,  cut into 8 squares (or desired size)
4 tbsp all purpose flour (use gluten free if needed)
½ cup coconut cream (can sub with vegan sour cream)

Tortilla Wraps, Bread, Crackers or Lettuce

8 ounces dry noodles of choice such as ramen or rice noodles; see notes for options

Optional Toppings (use as many as you like)

½ tsp salt more or less to taste
